posts.title: Ghost Stories for Christmas
posts.text: Did you know that telling ghost stories at Christmastime was a popular tradition in Victorian Britain?

posts.title: Some Pigs: Our Favorite Picture Books & Early Readers Starring Pigs
posts.text: Wilbur, Poppleton, Olivia, and more—here are some favorite picture books and early readers for fans of our porcine friends.

posts.title: Crack the Case: Middle Grade Mystery Books
posts.text: There are many wonderful mystery books for readers age 8 to 12 including puzzles, thrillers, and historical mysteries that will entertain anyone who enjoys the unraveling of a whodunit, and seeing justice meted out to the villains.

posts.title: Hit the Books: School Stories for Middle Grade Readers
posts.text: Some of these stories will make you laugh, some will make you laugh and cry, but they will all delight you as you enjoy the triumphs of ordinary children in extraordinary situations.

posts.title: Have a Picture Book Birthday Party for Your Child!
posts.text: On this list you will find a birthday story for every age from toddler to upper elementary school, and for every interest: humor, science, monsters, cute animals, and more.

posts.title: Picture Books Featuring Fabulous Felines
posts.text: Whether they wear top hats like Mr. Tiger in Mr. Tiger Goes Wild, or are their unadorned selves, books about tigers often have striking art. Here is a list of fun read-aloud stories about tigers, from a board book for the youngest listener all the way up to second graders.

posts.title: Children's Books That Take Place in Museums
posts.text: Did E. L. Konigsburg's 'From the Mixed Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler' leave you with the fantasy of living in a museum? You're not alone. Here are a few excellent books for children who love art, museums, or cool stories.

posts.title: Children's Books for Nature Lovers
posts.text: If you and your kids find yourselves wishing for a breath of fresh air, or a visit to a quiet forest, beach, or riverbank, these wonderful books about nature will inform and restore you.

posts.title: Children's Fantasy Novels Set in New York City
posts.text: These books are set in a variety of otherworldly New Yorks imagined by fourteen talented authors. NYC fans of the fantastical will enjoy these adventures set in their home town.

posts.title: New York Stories of the Past: Historical Fiction for Children
posts.text: The characters in these books struggle against: slavery, poverty, discrimination, being orphaned, and other difficulties both large and small. Read their adventures and share their lives as they overcome these perils, while making friends along the way.

posts.title: Picture Books About Famous New Yorkers
posts.text: New York is a diverse city filled with incredible people, and here are some books that will introduce young kids to a few of them.

posts.title: Celebrating Central Park in Books
posts.text: One of the most famous parks in the world, kids and middle graders can learn more about Central Park's history and also enjoy charming stories set there in these fiction and nonfiction reads.

posts.title: Contemporary Twists On Classic Children's Books
posts.text: If you're looking for appealing orphans, the warmth of a found family, or life in America's past these excellent books will satisfy your craving.

posts.title: Try This Strategy for Discovering New Books and Authors
posts.text: This reverse engineering tip may lead you to your next favorite read.

posts.title: Summertime Stories for Children Ages 8 to 12
posts.text: Readers can vicariously attend camp, visit grandparents, act in a play, have a first crush, solve a mystery, and more with these books.

posts.title: Five Tips for Raising a Reader
posts.text: Besides having an enjoyable way to pass the time, being a good reader helps children do well in school, and opens up worlds of knowledge.

posts.title: Travel Back to the Past (& Find Out What Kind of Underwear People Wore!)
posts.text: These books will give you a picture of how people lived, and what daily life was like throughout history.

posts.title: Food is Life! Foodie Memoirs to Enjoy
posts.text: Caution: these books will make you hungry.

posts.title: Escape to Another Planet, Time, or Universe With Sci-Fi & Fantasy E-Books
posts.text: "Leave" home for awhile with an escapist read.

posts.title: Feel Good Family Stories for Children Ages 9-12
posts.text: There are mysteries, magic, ghosts, and funny stories—all comforting stories of caring families.

posts.title: Comfort Reads for Anglophiles
posts.text: Sometimes I want to imagine that I live in a castle in England and at any moment the butler will inform me that "Dinner is Served."

posts.title: Popular Authors Who Write for Both Children and Adults
posts.text: Bond with your child over your love of a favorite author.

posts.title: Books for Unicorn Lovers of All Ages
posts.text: Do you know someone who has Unicorn Fever?

posts.title: Make a Resolution to Read More Poetry Next Year
posts.text: Sometimes, you read a poem and feel the poet peered into your heart and understood your emotions in ways you didn’t think another human being could. If you plan to read more poetry in 2020, here are some suggestions to start you on your poetry adventure.

posts.title: Planning Your Own Poetry Teatime
posts.text: Select your poetry books, set your table, serve some snacks, and have your very own special poetry teatime. Our recommendations, especially engaging for younger readers, can help.
